User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the DE-Bridge platform, whether a seeker or an expert.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

role.description: The role of the user: 'seeker' or 'expert'.

profilePhoto.description: URL of the user's profile photo stored in Firebase Storage.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

lastLogin.description: Timestamp of the user's last login.

Expert.title: Expert
Expert.description: Represents an expert on the DE-Bridge platform. This is a denormalized collection for public expert profiles.

id.description: Unique identifier for the expert entity (matches the corresponding userId).

name.description: The expert's full name (denormalized from User).

profilePhoto.description: URL of the expert's profile photo (denormalized from User).

currency.description: The currency for the hourly rate.

languages.description: Array of languages spoken by the expert.

totalSessions.description: The total number of sessions conducted.

Seeker.title: Seeker
Seeker.description: Represents a seeker on the DE-Bridge platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the seeker entity.

Booking.title: Booking
Booking.description: Represents a booking made on the DE-Bridge platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the booking entity.

scheduledTime.description: The scheduled time of the session.

duration.description: The duration of the session in minutes.

status.description: The status of the booking: 'pending', 'confirmed', 'completed', or 'cancelled'.

paymentId.description: Identifier from the payment gateway (e.g., Paystack).

amount.description: The amount paid for the session.

escrowStatus.description: The status of the escrow: 'held', 'released', or 'refunded'.

videoRoomId.description: The ID of the video room for the session.

documentsUploaded.description: URLs of documents uploaded for the session stored in Firebase Storage.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the booking was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the booking was last updated.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message exchanged between a seeker and an expert.

id.description: Unique identifier for the message entity.

conversationId.description: Unique identifier for the conversation. (Relationship: Conversation 1:N Message)

text.description: The text content of the message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

read.description: Indicates whether the message has been read.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a review given by a seeker or an expert after a session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the review entity.

rating.description: The rating given in the review (1-5).

comment.description: The comment provided in the review.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the review was created.

MedicalTranslation.title: MedicalTranslation
MedicalTranslation.description: Represents a medical translation generated by the Bio-LLM Medical Translator.

id.description: Unique identifier for the medical translation entity.

originalDocument.description: URL of the original medical document stored in Firebase Storage.

extractedData.description: JSON object containing the extracted medical data.

translatedSummary.description: The translated summary of the medical document.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the translation was created.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a conversation between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the conversation entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure is designed to support the DE-Bridge platform, emphasizing secure and scalable data management. It incorporates key principles like Authorization Independence through denormalization, Structural Segregation for consistent security, and standardized Access Modeling. A top-level `experts` collection is introduced to allow for efficient querying of all public expert profiles, which is a common requirement for the platform's 'Find an Expert' feature. This avoids costly and complex queries on the `users` collection. User-specific private data (like `seeker_details`) remains in subcollections under `/users/{userId}` to leverage path-based security rules. Shared resources like `bookings`, `conversations`, and `reviews` remain in top-level collections with denormalized IDs to facilitate secure access control.
